intro: Eclipta spicata, commonly known as blue daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open areas and thrives in sunny conditions. Its blue to purple flowers are surrounded by white ray florets, creating a striking appearance. Eclipta spicata is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
